data.title: Honor and Remember Nebraska
data.meta_description: Leo and Rudolph Blitz were born in Lincoln, NE on April 9, 1921. They were two of twelve children in the family of Russian German immigrants, Henry and Marie Christine Blitz.
data.text:
Steve was born in 1945 to Willard and Vance Campbell. He lived in Waterloo Nebraska where he graduated from Waterloo High School. He worked at Valmont Industries for a short time and decided to go to college. He attended Wayne State College in Nebraska. He taught for one semester at Bellevue High School before he decided to be a self-employed electrician.

Steve was a member of the Waterloo Village Board where he served as Mayor. He was an active member of Waterloo Volunteer Fire and Rescue Department when he died as the result of a rescue squad train accident on July 12, 1979.

Steve was survived by his wife, Mary, and his only child, Sarah Jane, who was born 3 weeks after his death. He was also survived by two brothers, Stu and Al Campbell.
